name: Manor Heath Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked a four night stay to celebrate our 54th Wedding Anniversary. Very clean in all areas of the hotel. Nice welcome, excellent breakfast with good choices and beautifully cooked. Room appeared small but that was because the bed was BIG. Do you want to dance around a bedroom or have a good nights' sleep?
reviews.title: Short Break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: View overlooked Peasholm Park, heating in the room if required, plentiful supply of tea and coffee.
reviews.title: short break at manor heath

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Promised to go back for our 60th.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lovely room very clean but small en suite with shower which proved very difficult to work. Due to situation next to a home of some sort we were woken early by staff having a break outside. Convenient location in quiet part of town and very efficient staff serving a lovely breakfast.
reviews.title: Impressed !!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012
reviews.text: My wife and I were made to feel very welcome on a short break. Excellent room, excellent food and very good value for money. The hotel was spotlessly clean with a well stocked bar, comfortable lounge and free wifi. Recommend most highly.
reviews.title: Very well looked after!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We checked tripadvisor before booking and saw extremely favourable reviews. They were all justified and we now join the list of satisfied cusomers. We spent the week-end of June 22 --23 so that we could participate in the Armed Forces Day events and found the hotel to be in a good position near Peasholm Park with parking facilities and only a short walk from North Bay.. It was spotlessly clean ( presumably reflecting the naval background of the Steve, the co-owner) and the breakfast was so good we did not require lunch. We also found the other guests very pleasant meaning the place had a nice atmosphere. We hope to return.
reviews.title: ANOTHER SATISFIED CUSTOMER THANKS TO TRIPADVISOR.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed during the bank holiday weekend in June, room was REALLY clean including the white bed linen. Breakfast was good - not amazing, but perfectly adequate and they were more than happy to top up the tea and toast. Owners were really friendly and happy to recommend outings. Only slight problem was the curtains in the room were very light and with the window above the bed this meant daylight wake up call before 6am! so if you like darkness maybe take a sleep mask.
reviews.title: Welcoming, clean and friendly owners

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall thought the hotel was great, good location, friendly staff and very clean, would recommend
reviews.title: Another great stay at Manor Heath Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Having been so impressed with Manor Heath Hotel on our first visit last year we had no hesitation in booking a short break again this year and we were not disappointed.
reviews.title: Great little hotel !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a lovely room at the front of the hotel overlooking Peasholme Park and we could see the sea. The king size bed was very comfortable and we slept very well indeed. Once again we were very impressed with the high standards of cleanliness and enjoyed an excellent breakfast each morning served by polite and friendly staff.
reviews.title: Outstanding small hotel in Scarborough

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This was my first stay in Scarborough having travelled there for the road race meet at Olivers Mount. My friends had been before and i can see why they keep returning to the same hotel. I travel a lot and in my opinion you cannot beat the value for money and the more personal service of a small hotel or guest house. THIS IS ONE OF THE VERY BEST
reviews.title: A GREAT SMALL HOTEL IN SCARBOROUGH

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hosts Steve and Ros made us most welcome, the standards set take some beating, great food, spotless rooms and efficient service all come as standard. Look forward to returning next year both the bikes and the hotel have me hooked,
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel could not be faulted in any way, sad to leave.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Mike East Stow on the Wold ,GLOS
reviews.title: This is a very overpriced B&B not a hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned home having spent a wonderful week at the Manor Heath hotel with my 4 year old grandson Liam. Steve and Ros could not have been more accomodating, having cooked meals especially for him. We had dinner every evening and the food was superb as was the service, same goes for breakfast. The location could not be better with the parks and sea front a short walk away. The staff were friendly and helpful, the room was a good size, everywhere spotlessly clean, and so muchh hot water. Most people we spoke to at the hotel had returned year after year which is testament in itself. Already my grandson is asking to go back, which we most certainly will.
reviews.title: This has got to be the worst hotel in Scarborough.........

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Firstly there is no way this can be classed as a hotel, it is very much an overpriced B&B. The owners live in the building and will jump out on you every time you walk in and won’t let you past without a load of chit-chat. It was very clean but our room stank of smoke and all of the corridors had a very overpowering smell of air freshener that will make your eyes water. The rooms are very tiny and the walls so thin that you can hear everything from the other room. The car park is very tight and has a stupid system of forcing you to park in the lowest number available. If you park in a higher number they are straight out telling you to move. If you are unlucky enough to be in space one good luck getting out without scraping along the fence in your way. The spaces are also far to close together to get young children in or out of your car. If you are staying here with young children good luck fitting a travel cot in the one square foot of floor space in the rooms.
reviews.title: Very Good Accomadation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is in a very quiet road in the North Bay overlooking Peasholme Park; a walk in to the main part of town is circa 15 minutes but the seafront only 5 minutes walk away.
reviews.title: Great Little Hotel

reviews.text: the breakfast freshly cooked and excellent. There is even an "honesty bar" where you can help yourself to drinks and sign a chit so in short you feel very much at home.

reviews.text: Will go again.
reviews.title: A great place to stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Well what can we say, another fantastic stay at the Manor Heath Hotel. Ros and Steve always provide a warm and friendly welcome, and we have come to look on them as friends now, even though we have only stayed there a couple of times. The hotel is always spotless, the food is always wonderful with plenty to choose from and you are always made to feel like you are staying in a home from home. Our son absolutely loves staying here and whenever we want a few days away from the stresses of every day living the Manor Heath is always the first place we all think of. We love how accessible it is to so many different places and is within easy reaching distance of home if we had to get back in an emergency but far enough away to be able to relax and enjoy the beautiful surrounding areas. We would gladly recommend staying here to anyone looking to stay in the area. Ros and Steve, thanks for another great stay, and Callan says Thank You for the Easter Egg ;0)
reviews.title: Excellent

description: The Manor Heath is a detached, licensed property situated in a prime location minutes from North Bay's golden sands. Front-facing rooms have delightful views across Peasholm Park towards the sea. All accommodation boasts en-suite facilities, tea/coffee making equipment, flatscreen televisions and hairdryers. Family-run, we focus on offering a personal service where good food and cleanliness feature high on our list of priorities.Whether you just want to enjoy a short break away from the bustle of city life or a longer holiday exploring the delights of the Yorkshire Coast, The Manor Heath Hotel is the ideal haven to relax and unwind. Call us for a chat to discuss your needs and we will try to make your stay a memorable one!
